name: Noun (Danh từ)
description: A word used to identify people, places, things, or ideas. Examples: book, teacher, happiness, London

name: Verb (Động từ)
description: A word that expresses an action, occurrence, or state of being. Examples: run, think, is, become

name: Adverbs (Trạng từ / Phó từ)
description: A word that modifies or describes a verb, adjective, or another adverb. Examples: quickly, very, yesterday, here

name: Adjective (Tính từ)
description: A word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun. Examples: beautiful, tall, blue, intelligent

name: Phrase (Cụm từ)
description: A group of words that functions as a single unit in a sentence. Examples: in the morning, piece of cake, break down

name: Pronouns (Đại từ)
description: A word that takes the place of a noun or noun phrase. Examples: he, she, it, they, who, which

name: Interjection (Thán từ)
description: A word or phrase that expresses strong emotion or sudden feeling. Examples: Oh!, Wow!, Ouch!, Alas!

name: Conjunction (Liên từ)
description: A word that connects words, phrases, clauses, or sentences. Examples: and, but, or, because, although

name: Preposition (Giới từ)
description: A word that shows the relationship between a noun/pronoun and other words in a sentence. Examples: in, on, at, by, for, with

name: Auxiliary words (Trợ từ)
description: Helper words used with main verbs to form tenses, questions, or negatives. Examples: is, have, will, can, must, do
